result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron N. Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
Costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts in the amount of $25 a month, beginning November 15, 2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant shall participate in any counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Defendant shall in good faith follow through with the inpatient treatment program.
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo AODA and follow through with any recommended treatement.

timeConds.notes:
No Huber and no Good Time.
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letters/correspondence to DE about payment plan
Incourt notice to DE after sentencing

1:18 PM Defendant Aaron N. Black in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Aaron N. Black.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty.
Plea agreement recited into the record. No corrections with the PSI. Court orders a withheld sentence and a placement of probation for 2 years with the following conditions; 5 days of jail with no Huber or good time in 22CF38, court costs on each count, DNA sample and surcharge on each count, a letter of apology to S.B due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the probation agent in 22CM4, AODA and any recommended treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent, in good faith follow through with the inpatient treatment program. Court dismisses but reads in the remaining counts in 22CF38. Defendant has 25 days credit in 22CF4 and 119 days in22CF38. Court orders a payment payment plan of $25 a month starting November 15, 2022. Parties ask for another status hearing on cases 22CM36, 22CM35, and 22CF39 scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 9:45a.m.-JN
Status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:02 AM Defendant Aaron N. Black in court, in custody.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Aaron N. Black. Plea agreement recited into the record. 22CF38 -  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information to be filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to count 1 in 22CF38 and 22CM4.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of 22CM4 - Battery and Count 1 in 22CF38 - Possess with Intent to Deliver.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts in 22CF38. Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  Court orders a PSI  -  Attorney Smith is requesting a furlough request.  Court indicates that if Mr. Smith can provide information where sheriff's department to assist in furlough court will entertain motion.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:03 PM Defendant Aaron N. Black in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Defendant Aaron N. Black in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim notification has been complied.    Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily. Statement by Attorney Tlusty regarding bond. Statement by Attorney Smith regarding bond.  Court is denying request to modify bond. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Initial Appearance set June 7, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared specially for Aaron N. Black.  Aaron N. Black appeared in person, in custody.  Probable cause was previously found.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $2,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Defendant was given notice of right to an attorney. Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 22CM4.   Initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
